title: day oatmeal diet may help reduce LDL levels by 10%
desc: Participants who primarily ate oatmeal for two days experienced a long-lasting reduction in LDL (“bad”) and total cholesterol levels, the results of a clinical trial show.

title: Highway 99 in Tulare County reopens after 59-vehicle pileup, CHP says
desc: Highway 99 in Tulare County has reopened after a 59-vehicle pile-up forced a total closure Saturday morning near Earlimart.

title: NASA’s Perseverance Rover completes 1st AI-planned drive on Mars
desc: NASA’s Perseverance rover has successfully completed its first AI-planned drives on Mars, using generative AI to autonomously chart routes and navigate challenging terrain, marking a major milestone in space exploration.

title: Sheapark Resource Hub is a development pathway for Upper West and Ghana - Speaker Bagbin

title: Union Budget 2026: CM Stalin flags 'unfulfilled promises', seeks fair share for Tamil Nadu
desc: In a post on X, Stalin listed a series of demands, asking whether the Budget would include a Rs 3,548 crore education fund to support the studies of students who have been detained and not promoted, funding for Coimbatore and Madurai Metro Rail projects, Rs 3,112 crore for the Jal Jeevan Mission, which Tamil Nadu is implementing effectively, new railway projects, and a 50% share of the Centre's tax revenue for states, as recommended by the Finance Commission.

title: Video of passenger vaping next to bus captain goes viral
desc: A video of a passenger vaping next to a bus captain has gained attention on social media.Posted by the Instagram account Sgfollowsall on Friday (Jan 30), a young man films himself vaping in bus 974. He discreetly approaches the bus captain, who was unaware of the man blowing out smoke in his direction.The 10-second clip has reached 198,000 views and...

title: Queensland rebate scheme used to purchase hundreds of potentially illegal e
desc: Hundreds of illegal, or potentially illegal e-bikes and e-scooters, were purchased under a state government rebate scheme, according to an internal audit that dates back to before the 2024 Queensland election.

title: Standard Chartered Arranges €641.1 Million In Financing For Uganda Power Grid, Roads, And Water Projects
desc: Standard Chartered has arranged €641.1 million in financing for the Government of Uganda to support three major infrastructure projects across power transmission, road upgrades, and water supply and sanitation, according to an announcement in Kampala. The signing took place at the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development (Uganda).
